content:

title: Moving/Copying mails from 1 acount to another account in IMAP fails
content:
I have 2 imap accounts set up in Thunderbird. When I try to Copy/Move a message from 1 account to another account, thunderbird will return an error that the APPEND is missing ')'.

I have turned on MOZ_LOG and it shows that the append has is wrong as the line ends as UTF8 (~{348+}

According to AI the ~ was inserted and the ) was dropped. It should have send ...UTF8 ({348})

The dovecot IMAP server is rejecting the the append.

How can I resolve this?

Screenprint of the log attached.

Kind regards,

Leo

title: Add gnome-text-editor as *optional* helper for application/octet-stream
content:
Most attachments come through as application/octet-stream which I should be perfectly able to view via "gnome-text-editor" or "gedit" etc. I want to be given the option to use one of these.

I don't see any mechanism in the menus to allow this, though. The "application/octet-stream" is conspicuously absent from the content-type list, which is absurd since that's what 99% of all attachments are recognized as.

Note that I want this as an *OPTION* to going through the steps of downloading and then viewing the file.

title: First couldn't get emails - error message "Unable to write the email to the mailbox.  Make sure the file system allows you write privileges and you have enough disk space to copy the mailbox."  TB now frozen, can't compact to fix.
content:
I couldn't get emails to download from server. This began 2-3 days ago, for no apparent reason. I got Unable to write the email to the mailbox. Make sure the file system allows you write privileges and you have enough disk space to copy the mailbox." I've never made any changes to the default program, so 'something' (maybe new update?) caused this problem (to my TB & and hubby's TB!) I tried to delete a LOT of emails and compact the file, but TB froze and I can't continue to compact, and CANNOT EXIT the program to try to restart. There's no way to try to fix this as long as I can't get TB to respond.

Interestingly, both my hubby and I had the same problem and it began during the same time period. We both have Windows 10/11. To try to fix his TB email, I deleted 5000+ emails, set the system to retain only the last 150-200 emails, and then was able to COMPACT the file. This seemed to magically return the email to its previous working order, and all current emails were downloaded. (Fingers crossed that this will still work properly when he checks email later today; others have said the problem returned.)

However - I'm not able to use the same 'fixes' to get MY TB to load email. I tried to delete a lot of emails and then 'compact', but it FROZE - showing this message: "Compact folders (Not responding) Thunderbird needs to do regular file maintenance to improve the performance of your mail folders. This will recover 685 MB of disk space without changing your messages. To let Thunderbird do this automatically in the future without asking, check the box below before choosing ‘Compact now’. " I can't get TB to recover the 685MB of disk space because it won't respond to anything.

I'm stuck. I hope someone can help. I checked some possible fixes via the community, and threw up my hands in despair when many of them needed 3-5 pages of instructions to complete the task! Help please? Thanks in advance.
creator: CuriousQ
